alert.note: Alert for Apple and Lucerne Valleys; San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:43PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact a portion of San Bernardino County through 445 PM PDT... At 341 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong, nearly stationary, thunderstorm near Johnson Valley, or 10 miles northeast of Big Bear City. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eastern Lucerne Valley, Hwy 38 Between Onyx Summit And Sugarloaf, western Johnson Valley, Hwy 18 Between Baldwin Lake And Lucerne Valley, Baldwin Lake, and Woodlands. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
